website_summaries.verdict: HP’s Chromebook x2 raises the bar for the two-in-one category, combining effective design, peppy performance and a fine display at a killer price.
pros: The x2's compelling design makes it simple to shift from laptop to tablet and back
The touchscreen looks good and is responsive
It has two cameras, and great speakers
There's a sufficient array of ports and connections
cons: Integrated storage is limited to a measly 32GB
The keyboard is a bit mushy

customer_reviews.title: Probably my best purchase
customer_reviews.text: Delivery came in a day late due to understandable Florida weather. This is by far the best laptop I've ever used! Ok so the processor and 4gb ram may appear subpar but dude does chrome os make use of it. In the one day I've used this, never any lag or buffer. Even initial set up was about 3 mins. Before this I had an i7 hp 12gb ram 1tb storage laptop but windows crippled it. I doubt I'll ever go back to windows. Outstanding product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jovi Seegobin

customer_reviews.title: Love my new detachable Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I just got it but I love it! It's beautiful and it started right up with all my information as I had a Chromebook before. It's fast, beautiful clear pictures and videos, detaches easily and feels very sturdy but lightweight, battery life could be a little longer but haven't had it run out yet. Love that it has a stylus but have not used that yet. So far I am extremely happy with it's sleek appearance and quick setup! Way to go HP and Google. Oh and the price was right. Got it $100 cheaper on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Heide Shumway

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality control-bright spots on the screen of multiple units.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this machine, and pretty much did with one huge exception. There was a bright spot on the display of the first unit I ordered, which was extremely irritating, but I loved the functionality of the device so I exchanged it. The second unit had the exact same problem in a slightly different area. Getting two defective units in a row was a real let down. They were both from the same vendor, so I don't know if they have a bad lot or what, but image quality issues like this shouldn't be a thing twice in a row.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Best Chromebook I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for a couple weeks so I'll come back and update but so far I love it. Great laptop, great tablet. I do all my schoolwork on it without a problem. Best chromebook and best laptop I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Webber

customer_reviews.title: Attempting to replace MacBook Pro 13, this ain’t it.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great chromebook it just did not suit my needs. It was great for what it is, a convertible tablet chromebook with an excellent keyboard p. I needed something bigger for a”home base type” chromebook. I returned with no issues at all and got the 14 inch Dell Inspiron Chromebook. Excellent screen, decent keyboard and trackpad. But the Dell is Heavy! Serves me better as a stationary home web browser, email checker, google docs preparer. Dang, the Dell is Heavy and it really feels solid. Oh I forgot, I was attempting to replace my old MacBook Pro 13 inch with a Chromebook. So far so good with the Dell, not so much with this HP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last two months.
customer_reviews.text: Not even two months old and it is dead. Won't boot up and displays ChromeOS Missing or Damaged. Won't recover from a media drive, and the best part it on the error screen, I noticed the screen has 4 large dead spots. Even without these issues, the balance is terrible and really this is just a tablet with a keyboard, not a Chromebook. I take responsibility for that since that is pretty clear in the description. But I can't stress enough, this is not a computer, but a tablet. Now I need to enter HP repairs, and just wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a teachers dream. It is light, convertible, looks great, and works fast! I love the touch screen, the pen, and the battery life! Since schools have all become google schools with 1-to-1 with chromebooks for students it is really important for the teachers to have a chromebook as well. I just didn't like having a cheap, durable chromebook with minimal features that students have. This combo gives me an upgraded, high-end chromebook with many more features and flexibility to use anywhere in the classroom! Awesome job HP and great price for the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: I tried all the companies. All the same, HP is the most serious and high quality. The data of this model is just great. The screen is clear and pleasant to view. Easy to work with MS OFFICE. The inclusion and loading of applications is very fast. Two cameras are also very good and not every model has it. Model size is ideal - 11.6 is a bit small, 13.3 is big. 12.3 lies comfortably on your lap.
customer_reviews.author: ALEKSANDR SHATAYLO

customer_reviews.title: Would have been five stars if my unit wasn't defective.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this chromebook. I'm pretty sure it had the best value for money if you're looking for a high-end chromebook at this price point. The device is beautiful and well-built, the keyboard is super comfy and the screen is just gorgeous. The only pet peeve I have is that this unit delivered to me has this whitish pinhole or mark on the bottom left of the screen. It's annoying to think that you thought you'll be receiving something brand-new and perfect but it's just not the case. Never thought I'd be on the receiving end of a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: keane king

customer_reviews.title: If you need to install a lot of Android Apps with Linux Apps, then this is not for you
customer_reviews.text: I like every single thing about this. In fact I use it in tablet mode 90% of the time. The only thing I want more would be the RAM (because I need more power for my work) and storage (32GB will leave only 12GB Max); the problem with storage is not about storing files because there is MicroSD card reader slot, but it is about installing apps must be on local storage, which must fit into that 32GB. There are problems that could be fixed later when downloading files from Linux or Android, it will go to MicroSD directly. But again, with the price, I am not complaining. BTW, I love the pen!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Leung

customer_reviews.title: It's very big
customer_reviews.text: I've used tablets before and really like them. This is a very nice machine. The keyboard engages and disengages smoothly. Battery life and charging is exceptional. The screen is beautiful. The screen is BIG, much bigger than my 10 inch Android, bigger than my Windows tablet. But the latest Chromebook update allows for split screen which is a major win on this device. I am new to Chromebooks, so there has been a learning curve, but I am favorably impressed by this machine. My only nit, the screen ratio is such that Netflix can't display in full screen.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: display is mirrored
customer_reviews.text: display is mirrored so for business application the product is useless. Only can use it inside. I cannot understand how it is possible nowadays to produce computers with these displays this is for kids for gaming but not for business.
customer_reviews.author: Matthias Albig

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the first detachable Chromebook on the market, it's the HP Chromebook X2 and it's a lovely piece of equipment. Great battery life, keyboard (not backlit but still not a deal breaker) and more on the pricey end of the Chromebook scale. I got a good deal from GreatDealsForU (about $200 less than retail and other online sellers)...totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Needs more ram and a back-lit keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Works great with light use. Easy to convert to tablet and back. Lags. Really could benefit from 2 more gigs of ram. The pc gets overwhelmed easily with apps and tabs in the background. Battery life is amazing. Never charge it in a single day's use. Even watch a couple of movies off the charger, no problem. Used it on a 10-hour flight without charging it. No problem. The keyboard is good, would be better if it were back-lit. The trackpad is mediocre, but not terrible
customer_reviews.author: Agent031693

customer_reviews.title: If you can get it....GET IT.....
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know why we have so many negative reviews. This Chromebook tablet is amazing. It's small enough to take anywhere. It's powerful enough to all my work task. The screen is amazing. It is super crisp. Battery life has been tremendous. Pen is not the class leader, but it is good. It does have just a little bit of lag. Best part is that I can use it as a tablet. I can also cast to my TV. Build quality is top notch. Does not feel cheap at all.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: HP Chromebook - fast and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I bought my HP Chromebook "like new" based on positive customer and expert reviews. The battery life is excellent and the screen and keyboard is very responsive. Good camera - very clear. You can detach it from the hinges to use as a tablet. This was an upgrade from my convertible Chromebook. I actually prefer how my other chromebook flipped around without detaching from keyboard. All in all happy with my HP purchase and with seller who was responsive.
customer_reviews.author: savvy shopper

customer_reviews.title: High quality build, Super hi-res screen, keyboard is ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: The screen resolution is super good but Chrome OS does not support hi-res fully because the system font becomes too small, and my kids hated the small fonts, so ended up having to use less than the max resolution. Don't expect the keyboard and trackpad to be as good as the MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!  HP, Bring this back!
customer_reviews.text: I wish they still made these! HP did this one right. I love the 3:2 ratio and 4G of RAM is plenty for my web development. 32G of space is a little light, but it's working and I have all my apps installed for both Android and Linux. Chrome OS is amazing. I can't think of any reason to revisit Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzaroni

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Easy, Flexible.
customer_reviews.text: This is now my primary device for browsing, or working on files in the cloud. Bigger than a phone. Smaller than a laptop. FAST. Having the detachable keyboard allows changing positions instead of always "sitting the same way". App updates are a snap. Note, the keyboard was dead on arrival. But HP support was great on the phone, and quickly sent me a box and packing to return the unit. It came back in about 5 days, and has worked perfectly since.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Horwege

customer_reviews.title: No worries
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly and everything sealed just like buying at HP..Fast beautiful screen colors right on brightness fantastic, no need for backlit keyboard..
customer_reviews.author: Technology 1000

customer_reviews.title: Bent
customer_reviews.text: Take extreme care, it will bend easily. I don't know how it happened, but it wouldn't fit the keyboard until I pressed on the back near the connection port. I treat tablets and phones gently. I've since carefully bent it back into shape. Update: bends real easy. I've had to straighten it three times now. Still not sure how it's getting bent.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Clark

customer_reviews.title: This has become my go-to travel computer
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something light I could take on business trips. Work provides me a laptop, but the battery life isn't great and it's bulky. This Chromebook is perfect for travel. Great battery life (8-10 hours depending on workload). I access work through the Citrix app and am able to do everything I need to using Google Play apps.
customer_reviews.author: Sam G.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Chromebook, terrible stylus
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid Chromebook. It overheats quickly. It is quick and responsive. Not a huge fan of the stylus. The one I got must be an old model because it takes batteries and has limited capabilities. The design for the stylus holder must've been an afterthought because there is absolutely zero ingenuity there.
customer_reviews.author: buffhawk84

customer_reviews.title: Good quality; easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made, and was incredibly easy for my wife to set up. Perfect for her since she mostly does email and plays games. She wanted something with a keyboard. I offered to get her an iPad with a keyboard case, but she felt like trying something new. I chose this after reading reviews on various tech sites for the best chromebook product.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. A couple of years ago I would not have considered a 2 in 1 or a cromebook, but times have changed. This is the nicest machine that I have owned since the cmos days. Really can't think of any negatives. Maybe more local storage, but this is less important on a cookbook than a Windows machine. NO has a winner
customer_reviews.author: Syracuse Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Worst. Laptop. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in July of 2019. TWICE now the stupid thing decides out of nowhere my Google sign in information is invalid. I have LOST EVERYTHING in my local data. It refuses to accept my previous passwords to restore the data. DO. NOT. PURCHASE! I regret everything about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Pray

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chromebook a flaw
customer_reviews.text: I love the HP Chromebook, it is sleek and beautiful and the speakers are reasonably loud enough. It meets my everyday use. However, when I received it, the front-facing camera is blurry, I tried everything to fix it, contacting HP with no luck. I use the Chromebook for personal use, so I frequently use Google Duo, which makes it not a nice experience using the device.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Sidu

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 18 months ago. My keyboard has been intermittent for the last year. It's been totally random. Sometimes it was sluggish. Sometimes it stopped completely. Turning it off and on didn't help. I did hard reset with no luck. It has finally stopped completely. I'm totally fed up.
customer_reviews.author: GRS

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good battery life, works as advertised. Quick startup, common interface, recognizable controls. I like the dual use nature of the device best. Being able to type on the keyboard but release the pad and sketch with the stylus. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: tmezzsc

customer_reviews.title: Lousy quality control, or is it intentional?
customer_reviews.text: Nice product that couldn't last. It was working one morning, and then refused to turn on ever again in the afternoon. Since the warranty expired in Jan 2020, and it's now May, I have no recourse. The last time I bought a HP laptop, it died the same way, also a few months after warranty expiry. Shame on you, HP.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky Tan

customer_reviews.title: The best tablet that I've ever touched!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly can't rave enough about this thing. I wanted a table that converted to a laptop and ran all of my Android purchases. This thing ticks all of the boxes and does it with panache!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fun to Use
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful convertible Chromebook. It's fun to use, either as a laptop or as a tablet. It's lightweight, sturdy, and the battery lasts forever. The included stylus is easy to forget about when you don't want to use it, but handy when you do want it.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Greene

customer_reviews.title: BENT SCREEN!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just opened box (no damage on box). Daughter able to turn on device with no problem, however, we noticed the screen is bent. Not very happy! I do not recommend buying large electronic products from Amazon! I would buy at best buy but since the “stay home” order is in place, we really can’t go anywhere 😞
customer_reviews.author: MomMaDukes4

customer_reviews.title: Worth it but know its not Mac or Windows
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and look of the unit and in the couple weeks I’ve had it I am very pleased. I am not crazy about the fact that it was not compatible with my current Canon printer. You do sacrifice some conveniences with the Chromebook platform.
customer_reviews.author: Tekchick

customer_reviews.title: Great 2-in-1. Great service.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this everyday since purchasing. First Chromebook purchase and I don’t believe I’ll be going back to a windows or Mac unless totally necessary. I’ve been taking classes on this and haven’t had any major concerns. Speed, WiFi connectivity are very good. I will be purchasing a sd card in the future, but with all my cloud usage, I haven’t had any memory issues so far. Fast service and product looked great when I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Latisha A. Waddell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for College Student
customer_reviews.text: I love this 2 in 1 Chromebook. I wanted to find something that would meet my needs as a current college student along with being something I could use in my future career also. It has a wonderful touch screen and for any of you who are wondering, the screen is a little bulky as a tablet, but if that’s what you’re looking for it’s amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love my chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this can function as a laptop or a tablet. Very lightweight and sleek. I do miss the microsoft applications but there are comparable programs pre-loaded that work pretty well. Also, I wish there were some additional buttons on the actual keyboard like delete but not a major issue. Overall, work great and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great 2 in 1 value
customer_reviews.text: I like the Chromebook x2's great screen resolution and being able to use it as laptop with keyboard or as a touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: RichA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for college
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like it at first because i was used to Windows..but now i really like it..battery life is more then perfect!i could literally take it with me all day without worrying about the battery .. its a little bit heavy so u can’t carry it around with one hand . Perfect for school or College . And the space is so small i had to buy a desk with usb adopter , for an easy way just buy an SD card .
customer_reviews.author: raghadsu

customer_reviews.title: The computer is a great travelling computer
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is fast. That I can merge my phone to it and send text messages on it. I can watch netflix on it. I am using it for travelling with. entertainment purposes. E mails ,pictures etc. But as a desk top computer, for business etc . It's not there yet. Probably it will be but businesses are not using chrome
customer_reviews.author: james clendening

customer_reviews.title: It doors a lot for less.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter.It does everything she needs.365 Suite, watching movies,school work.Touch screen is great with included pen.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony O. Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: I really only use this as a search engine to surf the internet. The speakers are horribly muffled but I’m sure one could always get a different set to use. Overall good value for the $ spent
customer_reviews.author: Erin Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great two-in-one device.
customer_reviews.text: Love this chromebook! Great for casual use and school work. I absolutely love using it in tablet mode. Not the best device but since its a two for one, I can hardly complain.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Love this Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Like Chromebooks. Very capable . Fast. Excellent screen. Works well as laptop or tablet. Like to be able to use it as a detached tablet. Tablet does get a little warm. Still learning how to use more of its features but I like the machine.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one year
customer_reviews.text: One year after I bought the product, it stopped working. It just won't turn on. It had been sitting on my desk for months. No physical damage.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: There were so many options that I couldn’t decide which one to get. All I can say is that I am extremely happy with this purchase, great quality, nice design and it works great. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and portable
customer_reviews.text: It's not the traditional Laptop but actually like a tablet with a keyboard attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Ifeanyi N.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Screen is a little fragile feeling. Otherwise seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Audio is the maim problem
customer_reviews.text: If you want to watch videos or hear music I strongly recommend that you avoid this product. Sometimes it's just the first few minutes that are inaudible and sometimes the crackling sound go on forever.
customer_reviews.author: Pascal J Massie

customer_reviews.title: Computer
customer_reviews.text: Just what my son needed for college. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Gates

customer_reviews.title: Great but came damaged
customer_reviews.text: I like the device, however it came to me dented on the top. I may just keep it since it's just a small dent but if it wasnt a hassle, I would definitely return to get a new one without a dent.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Lamorena

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had a touchscreen 2 in 1 chromebook before, but I wanted one with a detatchable keyboard so I can use the screen solely as a tablet. This is exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Great alternate to school issued chrome book.
customer_reviews.text: Used as high schooler’s chrome book. Much lighter and more compact than issued devices.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M

customer_reviews.title: Faulty screen. And replacment touchscreen stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Tried to contact the seller to pay to fix it but it says the "window" for all of that is gone and wont even let me view their sale page. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Devin Hushagen

customer_reviews.title: PURCHASED NEW LAPTOP AND RECIEVED USED LAPTOP
customer_reviews.text: The laptop itself is amazing. HOWEVER, I ordered from the new option and recieved a used laptop. Which is very disappointing. All the parts and pieces were there but someones account was already logged in as the "owner".
customer_reviews.author: Arianna Smith

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it was a good chrome book until it wouldn’t turn out today
customer_reviews.text: Product was fine, but today went to turn on and it will no longer boot up. Tried charging and troubleshooting and nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Reattaching the tablet takes getting used to. Shifting from the pen to finger sometimes confuses the tablet but otherwise it’s a decent laptop.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Super fast boot up and beautiful screen
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this tablet / laptop. Would highly recommend. So happy that I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Tona

customer_reviews.title: A very good valued modern chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Excellent detachable screen, with the provided pen, formed a good note taking tools
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Shing

customer_reviews.title: HP 2in1
customer_reviews.text: It’s not very good for painting, but for work its norm
customer_reviews.author: School of Tomorrow

product_meta.title: HP 2-in-1 12.3" Touch-Screen Chromebook Intel Core M - 4GB Memory - 32GB eMMC Flash Memory (X2 12-F014D) White - New
product_meta.description: HP x2 Convertible 2-in-1 Chromebook: Run programs on this 12.3-inch HP Chromebook convertible laptop. Its detachable touch-screen display lets you enjoy brilliant 2K content, and you can write and draw on it with the included Active Pen. This HP Chromebook convertible laptop has 32GB of storage, and its Intel Core m3 processor and 4GB of RAM provide smooth performance. Learn more about Chromebooks ›
feature_bullets: Google Chrome OS; 7th Gen Intel® Core M-7Y30 processor; 12.3" display; 4GB memory; 32GB eMMC Flash Memory; Bluetooth; touch screen; DVD/CD drive not included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars166 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
